location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire Residency to Captain Charles Sealy, Commander of the HC Cruizer Ternateand Senior Marine Officer in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the receipt of a communication from Captain Sealy, dated 9 September 1824, but notes that as not all the Arabic language material has been translated, the Resident is not in a position to give a full response. Instructions are given however indicating that should the feud between Shaikh Tahnoon [Ṭaḥnūn bin Shakhbūṭ Āl Nahyān] and Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Saqr] escalate into war, British naval forces should not get involved.It is also noted that the Resident intends to investigate the case of the Sharga [Sharjah] boats captured by [? Salmine] bin Nasser.
